body.name: K&F Concept 78 inch Camera Tripod for DSLR Compact Aluminum Tripod with 360 Degree Ball Head and 10KG Load for Travel and Work K234A7+BH-28L (S210)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 13 hrs 5 mins
features: 28mm Large 360° Metal Ball-Head:With two independent control knobs, the specially designed 28mm metal ball-head can rotate 360 degree allowing you to take photos at any angle with horizontally and vertically.

Convenient: From 23'' to 78'' Flexible Adjustment.4-section column legs with 3 quick release flip-locks allows you to adjust the working height from 23.4'' to 78' in seconds.19.3" folden size is easily took to anywhere for outdoor photography

Multi-angle Shooting: Center Column could turn to invert situation for low angle shooting;The damping system of the ball head would set your camera at different angles easily(vertical shots or up-side shots) or and get the best shooting view.

Portable:3.17lbs / 1.44kg tripod weight and 22lbs / 10kg maximum load weight. 78'' in height and easy-carried. This tripod can make it the best companion of your DSLR cameras and withstand heavier load compared to similar products yet remain stable.

2-In-1 Tripod Monopod: The tripod can be easily truned into a monopod or walking stick alone to make your photography more diverse. Multi-angles for shooting like low-angle shot and high-angle shot are allowed with this monopod as well.

1. How to choose the height of the tripod? Choose a tripod that is suitable for your height. Tripod height=your height-15cm-camera height. If you have additional requirements, you can choose according to the actual situation. 2. What is the difference between carbon fiber tripod and aluminum tripod? For the same size tripod,carbon fiber will weigh about 30% less than aluminum alloy, and its strength will be higher, and it will not rust. But the value is also higher. 3.How to choose the tripod loading capacity? You can choose according to the weight of camera and lens, for example your equipment is 2kg, it is suggested to choose the tripod bearing above 4kg. 4.What is the difference between the twist lock and the lever lock? The structure of the twist lock is simple, easy to replace parts, disassemble, clean and maintain. The lever lock opens faster and is easy to operate with one hand. 5. Can other gimbal be installed? Yes, any gimbal with a 3/8-inch port on the bottom is compatible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars OMG this tripod is HIGH QUALITY!
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the K&F Concept 78-inch Camera Tripod designed for DSLR use. This compact aluminum tripod comes equipped with a 360-degree ball, and let me tell you, it has proven to be the best investment for securing my teleprompter in place.As someone who relies on a teleprompter for various projects, stability is key to ensuring smooth and professional recordings. The K&F Concept tripod has exceeded my expectations in this regard.The 78-inch height provides ample elevation, allowing me to position the teleprompter at the perfect eye level for comfortable reading during shoots. The robust construction of the aluminum tripod ensures durability, providing a sturdy foundation for my equipment.The 360-degree ball head is a standout feature, offering incredible flexibility in adjusting the angle of the teleprompter. This adaptability is crucial for capturing the best shots and accommodating different shooting environments.What sets this tripod apart is not just its technical features but also its user-friendly design. Setting it up is a breeze, and the quick-release plate simplifies the process of attaching and detaching my teleprompter swiftly.In terms of portability, the compact design makes it easy to transport to different locations, ensuring that I can maintain consistency in my video productions wherever I go.In conclusion, the K&F Concept 78-inch Camera Tripod has proven to be an invaluable asset for my teleprompter setup. It provides the stability, height, and flexibility needed for professional video recording. If you're in search of a reliable tripod to hold your teleprompter in place, I highly recommend considering this one. It has truly been the best purchase for enhancing the quality and efficiency of my video production setup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We gave this to our grandson for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. It’s compact, easy to use, well made and fits his needs. I highly recommend this tripod!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I bought this tripod to mount my Celestron 20x80 astronomy binoculars on. It works great! I'm 6"5" tall and I can stand at full height and use the tripod with the binoculars mounted on it. It's easy to move the binoculars up & down and side-to-side. I couldn't believe the flexibility the tripod provides in height adjustment. Definitely worth the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very solid tripod.
reviews.reviewText: I want to start off by say I didn’t elect to keep this bipod only because it was on the heavy side for hunting. In the description it states the weight as 3.14lbs. I weighed it and it was 4.17. Having said that the height, functionality, engineering, and controls were awesome. For a tall photographer that doesn’t have to move a bunch in my opinion this is the tripod for you. If you’re a hunter who’d rather have strength over weight then this too is for you. For being an aluminum tripod it actually it quite lite. I elected to get the 64” version to save a pound or so because I liked it that much.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality of the components
reviews.reviewText: K&F is a very good company, The Tripods is very stable and has weight according to its size. its very good finishes. and is designed for use in different environments. I am happy with tripod and now I am waiting two UV protector lens and a Backpack the same brand. I like it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid, Easy to Use
reviews.reviewText: In 2017 I was photographing the eclipse in WY and my 40-year-old tripod that I hadn't used in 20+ years let me down. Unfortunately, I didn't do any dry runs before heading out to WY, so I didn't realize it needed some maintenance. The tripod besides being old was pretty inexpensive when I bought it, and this led to some of its adjustments being difficult to make fine changes to.So, with the 2024 eclipse being 10 weeks away, I bought a new tripod. Knowing I'd probably only use it 2-3x per year, I didn't want to spend too much but I wanted something better than my old one.I am really happy with this unit. I've done several sessions of shooting the sun to work out exposures and ISO in preparation for April and the ease and smoothness of making fine adjustments as the sun moved across the sky was apparent in the first few minutes. I am particularly happy with the ball and socket for the camera platform. So in April, this tripod will hold my camera and the old one will hold my 8x56 Skymaster binos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well built from brand I have come to trust.
reviews.reviewText: Let me first state that this tripod in hand is heavier than I had expected or hoped, but this is entirely my fault for not paying attention to the item description and reading the unit's weight. While it does weigh more than my other older one, it is as a result more sturdy. More important for me is the functionality I get. Positioning the tripod, extending the legs, and working with the ballhead gives me zero problems. While I do not necessarily need it, I do like the fact it came with a bag as well. Turning this into a mono-pod was easier than I expected. Ultimately I am more than satisfied. The quality of the tripod & ballhead are enough to really make me question why people spend $$$ on certain brand (other than the ego of owning said brand). For amateur to semi-pro this unit will be more than enough. Glad I purchased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I bought it for the legs, disappointed with the design of the head
reviews.reviewText: I won't spend any time discussing the legs except that I am satisfied with them, and thankfully my old Oben head attaches just fine. The K&F ball head on the other hand is not usable for me.Any component like this is only as good as the weakest link, and in this case it is the attachment plate that screws to your camera body. In my case, when I tighten that screw completely in where it can turn no further (for the threads on both my Nikon Z5 and FTZ adapter), the plate is still loose. Basically the unthreaded portion of the screw is too long. So now the only way I can ever make it work is to engineer a solution; either by grinding the screw down a bit (though there aren't a lot of extra threads) or by fashioning a friction gasket between the plate and camera body. I'm leaning toward the latter because the rubberized "K&F" symbol on the plate looks woefully inadequate to begin with. Whoever designed this should be embarrassed. Whoever approved mass production and sale should be fired.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quality tripod for a reasonable price.
reviews.reviewText: This tripod is solid!Even fully extended, it is stable.And the price is only a few dollars more than the cheap and wobbly tripods I have far too many of.The cellphone adapter is a nice bonus.

Me gusto, funciona excelente lo utilizo para mis binoculares para la observación nocturna de estrellas y funciono muy bien a la altura máxima sigue estable, es ligero de transportar y compacto se siente de gran calidad, lo recomiendo

Auf der Suche nach einem Allroundstativ was leicht und preislich günstig ist, bin ich nach langer Suchebei diesem Stativ fündig geworden. Es ist gut durchdacht, qualitativ hochwertig und sehr funktional.Lässt sich auf 45 Zentimeter zusammen klappen, optimal für den Rucksack.Es steht ziemlich stabil und ist schnell auf Höhe gebracht. Bei mir sogar über 170 cm. Neben Handyund Skope, hält es auch meine Panasonic Lumix 2000. Lediglich beim Auslösen wackelt es dann,es sei denn man hält das Stativ beim Auslösen mit einer Hand fest.Für den Preis und die vielfache Anwendermöglichkeit von mir eine klare Kaufempfehlung.

reviews.reviewTitle: Il miglior treppiedi che abbia mai avuto
reviews.reviewText: Il treppiedi se montato con tutti i tubi prolunga in dotazione , diventa molto più alo di quanto dichiarato, perdendo quasi nulla in stabilità, ma solo se si carica con qualcosa di pesante, ma per reflex senza obiettivi pesanti o telecamere piccole è perfetto! Comodissimo il piede singolo che si stacca facendo da monopiede. compromesso peso/stabilità eccellente, io lo uso nelle uscite trekking e non mi pesa più di tanto. Infine trovo molto utile il gancio al di sotto del tubo centrale su quale attaccare lo zaino o la custodia stessa del treppiedi appensantita in modo da fare da contrappeso e rendere il tutto più stabile! Super consigliato
Easy to use. Not too heavy
